title: [BUG] SkglView.InvalidateSurface() call causes two calls of SkglView.PaintSurface event handler on Xamarin.Forms for MacOS
body:
**Code**

xaml:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<ContentPage xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms"
             xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml"
             xmlns:forms="clr-namespace:SkiaSharp.Views.Forms;assembly=SkiaSharp.Views.Forms"
             x:Class="App1.MainPage">
    <StackLayout VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" BackgroundColor="Goldenrod">
        <forms:SKGLView  x:Name="SkglView" VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand"  PaintSurface="SKGLView_OnPaintSurface" />
        
        <Button  x:Name="Button1" Text="Button1"
                 AnchorX="0" AnchorY="0" BackgroundColor="Cornsilk"
                 Clicked="Button_OnClicked"
        />
    </StackLayout>

</ContentPage>

```

code behind:

```

        private void SKGLView_OnPaintSurface(object sender, SKPaintGLSurfaceEventArgs e)
        {
            e.Surface.Canvas.Clear();
            
            using var fillPaint = new SKPaint {Style = SKPaintStyle.Fill, Color = SKColors.Gold};
            e.Surface.Canvas.DrawRect(e.Surface.Canvas.LocalClipBounds, fillPaint);
        }

        private void Button_OnClicked(object sender, EventArgs e)
        {
            SkglView.InvalidateSurface();
        }
```

**Basic Information**

Xamarin.Forms 4.8.0.1269
SkiaSharp.Views.Forms 2.80.1

**Reproduction Link**
[AppSkia3.zip](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/files/5076307/AppSkia3.zip)
